show.subtitle: Stories and news that affect us all
show.title: Leid Stories

title: Leid Stories
content:
Democrats and Republicans Feast on Pork at Debt Ceiling Banquet   Old habits die hard in Washington. <!--more--> When it comes to earmarks – the proverbial “bacon” to be brought home – old habits don’t die at all.
  The down-to-the-wire agreement Senate leaders worked out Wednesday to avert the catastrophe of a default on the government’s $17-trillion debt burden had several “surprise” projects in it that most legislators in the House and Senate didn’t know they had approved – pretty much like how Obamacare legislation was passed.
  In crisis there is opportunity, and it appears Democrats and Republicans seized the opportunity during their closed-door negotiations to dine high on the hog.
Billions of dollars approved for pork-barrel projects, and it’s a mystery how they were budgeted for and by whose authority.
